subject: Online Perl Resources
header: Recently someone shared the link to GitHub repository that holds virtually every possible online Perl resources. I was pleasantly surprised to see Perl Weekly Challenge listed as "Friendly Coding Competition". I am sure you will find the list very useful.
Curtis, shared open questions related to the Cor. Please do check out if you are interested in Cor.
Have you ever wonder how to estimate the level of your Perl mastery? Now you don't need to look anywhere, you can find the answer here. Please treat it as fun.
Last but not the least, stay home and stay safe. Enjoy reading the rest of the newsletter.

entries.title: Outreachy Intern announced - Areesha working on Open Food Facts
entries.author: makoto_nozaki
entries.text: Makoto annouced Areesha as Outreachy Intern, who  is a Software Engineering student doing her bachelor’s from the National University of Sciences and Technology, Islamabad, Pakistan.

chapters.title: Perl Weekly Challenge
chapters.header: The Perl Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Anwar will help you step out from your comfort-zone. You can even win the prize money of $50 Amazon voucher by participating in the weekly challenge. We pick one winner at the end of the month among all the contributors of the month. The monthly prize is kindly sponsored by Peter Sergeant of PerlCareers.

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Don't miss the fun and try new challenges every week. For more information, please read FAQ page.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge - 061

chapters.title: Perl Tutorial
chapters.header: A section for newbies and for people who need some refreshing of their Perl knowledge. If you have questions or suggestions about the articles, let me know and I'll try to make the necessary changes. The included articles are from the Perl Maven Tutorial and are part of the Perl Maven eBook.

entries.author: thomas_klausner
entries.text: As all the in-person events are cancelled many groups started to organize on-line events.
entries.title: Perl Virtual Events?

entries.text: Instead of the in-person Perl Conference, the TPF started to organize an even in the Cloud. You can already submit your talk proposals!
entries.title: The Perl Conference in the Cloud
